body.p:
Novr. 11th 1863
To His Excellency
Thos E. Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky

Your petitioner William B Fitzpatrick of Adair County respectfully represents that at the May term 1863 of the Adair Circuit Court he was fined the sum of one hundred & fifty dollars upon a charge of misdemeanor. He states that he is a young man and has to rely solely upon his own exertions for a support. To pay this amount would involve him to an extent so considerable that he would not be able to recover for several years. Mr Joseph Bowyer & myself had some difficulty on an election day. We each I suppose thought we were right. I thought that he desired to attack me as he in deed & in truth did. I in good faith believing that he would use great violence to me defended myself as I think I should have done & by my presence of mind prevented him from drawing a pistol from his boot. He had one in his boot or concealed about his person. I am a small feible man. Bowyer is a very athletic muscular man & I felt myself in danger in a conflict with him & acted accordingly. I was fined by the jury one hundred & fifty dollars which I think it would be oppressive
for me to pay as I believe that he Bowyers was more in fault than I was.
Hoping that Your Excellency will remit the part of said fine which goes to the Commonwealth of Kentucky I remain Respectfully
We were of Counsel for the petitioner & represent that we consider it a proper case for the interposition of Executive clemency

Timoleon Cravens
T T Alexander
Jas Garrett
We join in the prayer of this petition & believe it is a proper for the exercise of Executive Clemency.

Fon T Fox Judge of the Adair Circuit Ct
